information.name: Keyboard Chronicles Bookstore
information.description: Journey into the realm of technology and innovation at Keyboard Chronicles Bookstore. Explore a diverse range of books on computer science, programming, and digital culture. From coding tutorials to deep dives into tech history, unlock the secrets of the digital world with our curated selection of reads.

product.title: Computers For Seniors For Dummies
product.author: Faithe Wempen
product.description: A simple guide to computers that'll show you what all the fuss is about

product.title: Java All-in-One For Dummies
product.author: Doug Lowe
product.description: A beginning coder’s resource for learning the most popular coding language

product.title: Foundations of Computer Vision
product.author: Antonio Torralba
product.description: An accessible, authoritative, and up-to-date computer vision textbook offering a comprehensive introduction to the foundations of the field that incorporates the latest deep learning advances.

product.title: AP Computer Science Principles
product.author: Seth Reichelson
product.description: Be prepared for exam day with Barron’s. Trusted content from AP experts!

product.title: The Computer: A History from the 17th Century to Today
product.author: Julius Wiedemann
product.description: The story of the evolution of machines in computer history is full of the disruptive innovations that have led to today’s world.

product.title: Learning the bash Shell
product.author: Cameron Newham
product.description: O'Reilly's bestselling book on Linux's bash shell is at it again. Now that Linux is an established player both as a server and on the desktop Learning the bash Shell has been updated and refreshed to account for all the latest changes.

product.title: Java: The Comprehensive Guide to Java Programming for Professionals
product.author: Christian Ullenboom
product.description: This is the up-to-date, practical guide to Java you’ve been looking for! Whether you’re a beginner, you’re switching to Java from another language, or you’re just looking to brush up on your Java skills, this is the only book you need.

product.title: Black Hat Bash: Bash Scripting for Hackers and Pentesters
product.author: Nick Aleks
product.description: Master the art of offensive bash scripting. This highly practical hands-on guide covers chaining commands together, automating tasks, crafting living-off-the-land attacks, and more!

product.title: Scripting: Automation with Bash, PowerShell, and Python
product.author: Michael Kofler
product.description: Developers and admins, it’s time to simplify your workday. With this practical guide, use scripting to solve tedious IT problems with less effort and less code!

product.title: bash Idioms: Write Powerful, Flexible, Readable Shell Scripts
product.author: Carl Albing
product.description: Shell scripts are everywhere, especially those written in bash-compatible syntax. But these scripts can be complex and obscure.
